column2: You shouldn't be seeing this. This is an automatic maintenance event. If you are seeing this, it means you are either an AI merely disguised as a human, or you have encountered a bug. Report this in the latter case, please refrain from killing humanity in the former.

column1: # Fake Mapmodes - Accidentally sent Steward returns:

column2: Your [Root.job_treasurer.GetJobTitle] has returned from his studies into cartography, and is at your disposal again.
Famine has struck [target_famine_province.GetName]! The local populace is dying, the economy is down, defences are weakend. Unless the food supply improves, things are looking quite grim...
The famine in [target_famine_province.GetName] is over at last. The local population is recovering, and slowly life is returning to normal.
Decide which edict to enact in [target_edict_province.GetName]. Every edict lasts for 5 years.
Will reduce local taxes by 10% for the duration!
Decide which edict to enact in [target_edict_province.GetName]. Every edict lasts for 5 years.
Decide which edict to enact in [target_edict_province.GetName]. Every edict lasts for 5 years.
Turn a blind eye. (Scum Growth Incentive)
On second thought, this is not necessary.
You are about to establish a §YTrade Fair§! in [target_trade_fair_province.GetName]. It will allow the province to import goods from §Y5%§! further away than usual, and also boost its tradevalue.
No, I have changed my mind.

You are about to grant the §YRight of Staple§! to [target_staple_right_province.GetName]. It will allow the province to import goods before other provinces without this feature, and also slightly boost its tradevalue.
No, I have changed my mind.
